results.title: Conquering the sea
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Discusses new methods of exploiting the resources of the sea to be expected in the next century: fish farming and other means of food production, underwater mining and permanent residence for those employed, extraction of dissolved minerals, desalination for fresh water, and power generation.

results.title: Art for tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
In an exploration of the reactions to and applications of science and technology in the field of art, we are shown into the studios of various artists, such as Victor Vasarely and Yaacov Agam in Paris. The bizarre machines of Tinguely display a jaundiced attitude towards the values cherished by our technological era.

results.title: The Wild cell
results.creator_credit: Aram Boyajian, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Reviews what is known about the causes, diagnoses and treatments of cancer. Uses photo- micrography, animation, and multi-screen techniques to show how cancer effects and spreads through the body

results.title: What are we doing to our world
results.creator_credit: Edmond Levy, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Discusses the serious changes in the ecology if many environments caused by industrial pollution, taking Lake Erie as an example. Oil, silt, sewage and various industrial wastes and pesticides have destroyed most of the lake’s fish. Also considers the effects of water and air pollution, including such problems as the “Greenhouse effect” from increased atmospheric carbon dioxide, which is influencing climate and the radioactive contamination arising from disposal of nuclear waste.
results.title_for_label: What are we doing to our world
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edmond Levy, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News

results.title: A Trip from Chicago
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”
Discusses ideas for advanced forms of public transport over varying distances of hundreds or thousands of miles. High-speed ground vehicles using rocket power and roller bearings, sealed tubes or air-cushion support, vertical takeoff aircraft, jets and rockets are discussed with their designers and prototypes are demonstrated. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Standing room only
results.creator_credit: Sidney Meyers, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Considers the implications of the world’s burgeoning population growth depicting ideas for distributing food surpluses, exploiting the oceans, increasing agricultural activity. Examines several of the procedures including birth control whereby this growth can be controlled. Reporter: Walter Cronkite.

results.title: Shape of films to come
results.creator_credit: Willard Van Dyke, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
This film surveys the new techniques of motion picture which are revolutionising the industry and promising even more startling visual effects in the future. Among techniques presented are films made by computers, a mixed-media combination of live dancers and movies, films that depend on multiple screen effects, and shows using many screens of different sizes and shapes. One film demonstrated allows the audience to alter the plot line as it progresses.

results.title: The Remarkable school house
results.creator_credit: Peter Poor, Isaac Kleinerman and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Shows new teaching methods in use, particularly computer applications, and discusses the changes in schools to be expected in coming decades. Reporter Walter Cronkite.

results.title: New weapons against crime
results.creator_credit: Norton Bloom, Burton Benjamin and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Demonstrates the application of modern technology to combat crime. Shows uses of computers, voice prints, olefactronics to identify odours, video tape to record crimes, electronic eavesdropping devices, and chemicals to restrain violence.

results.title: Miracle of the mind
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Webster, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “21st Century”.
Describes the attempts made by humans to understand the nature of the mind, and surveys the contribution science has made to this understanding. Evaluates present knowledge of the brain and mental functions in terms of future civilisation. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicholas Webster, Isaac Kleinerman and CBS News
